benchmark_details.name: MVBench (Multi-modal Video understanding Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: MVBench aims at comprehensively evaluating the temporal perception capabilities of multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) in the open world, covering 20 challenging video tasks that require temporal understanding.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of MVBench is to evaluate the temporal understanding capabilities of MLLMs.

data.source: Collected from 11 existing public video datasets, including STAR, PAXION, and CLEVRER.
data.annotation: Automatic annotation through large language models.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy calculated based on the proportion of correct answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better temporal understanding performance by the models.
methodology.baseline_results: VideoChat2 achieved an accuracy of 66.0%, outperforming leading models by over 15%.
methodology.validation: Comprehensive evaluations against various MLLMs are conducted.
